thread.title: The Roc Nation Brunch Is Actually The Best Part Of Grammys Weekend
thread.title_full: The Roc Nation Brunch Is Actually The Best Part Of Grammys Weekend

author: Sylvia Obell
title: The Roc Nation Brunch Is Actually The Best Part Of Grammys Weekend
text:
View this image ›
Kevin Winter / Getty Images ID: 10521673 2. And Beyoncé’s first performance with her unborn twins. View this image ›
Kevin Winter / Getty Images ID: 10521723 3. But the actual best thing to come out of the all the Grammy celebrating was the annual Roc Nation Pre-Grammy brunch on the Saturday morning before the ceremony. Loading View on Instagram
instagram.com ID: 10521688 4. First of all, everyone showed up to the Owlwood Estate looking like wealth! View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images ID: 10520859 5. Diddy and Jay Z came in like two walking glasses of rosé. View this image ›
Ari Perilstein / Getty Images This may be the best either of them has ever dressed in their entire lives.
ID: 10520875 6. They have to do an Easter Sunday suit line now, for the culture. Ari Perilstein / Getty Images
Ari Perilstein / Getty Images
 ID: 10521057 7. Rihanna also showed up in her Sunday best and stayed by the food for most of the party because she’s all of us. View this image ›
Ari Perilstein / Getty Images ID: 10521038 8. The entire guest list was like a dream. Two of the three Jonas brothers were in attendance and an etherial looking Demi Lovato. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images ID: 10520858 9. Big Sean and Jhene Aiko brought the PDA. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images ID: 10520848 10. T.I. and Adrien Brody (who even knew they knew each other?!) brought the cool. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images ID: 10520847 11. Jaden Smith and Justine Skye held it down for the young, black, and fancy Calabasas delegation. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images ID: 10520846 12. DJ Khaled actually put down his phone for a few minutes, and 2 Chainz wore a purse. View this image ›
Ari Perilstein / Getty Images ID: 10520871 13. Rihanna and Jesse Williams looked at each other the way we wished they would look at us. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images The fan fiction possibilities here are endless.
ID: 10520850 14. There was even a rare Pusha T sighting — although his GOOD Music partner, Kanye West, was notably missing. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images One more time for Jay’s suit.
ID: 10520857 15. Either way, it was lit, fam. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images ID: 10520842 16. Everyone clearly had more fun than they did later that weekend at the Grammys. View this image ›
Kevin Mazur / Getty Images LOL Riri.
ID: 10520855 17. I MEAN, LOOK AT THIS BLACK BOY JOY! Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @diddy ID: 10521379 18. It was like one big, bad, bougie cookout. Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @emelisande ID: 10521388 19. Moguls everywhere you looked. Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @rocnation ID: 10522082 20. Every single photo taken was ICONIC. View this image ›
Ari Perilstein / Getty Images “Black excellence, opulence, decadence!”
ID: 10521311 21. Good job, Jay. View this image ›
Ari Perilstein / Getty Images Also, please invite me next year.
ID: 10520881
 More News About Rihanna, Jaden Smith
